name: Radisson Blu Beke Hotel, Budapest

reviews.text: Stayed here on business and booked by company travel agent. The website makes this place look quite grand, it really isn't. It just verges on OK - it's clean and functional, has everything you need but only just.
reviews.title: Tired and faded - stay somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was fairly large but the bed was so uncomfortable I had to roll up all the duvets to sleep on top of them, which left a nylon blanket for cover. It didn't matter, the air con was so ineffectual the room was roasting anyway. The cover on the bed was dirty and smelly, there was no way I was touching it so that got chucked on the floor every night. I did ask them to change it but nothing happened. The sheets and pillows were clean though so it wasn't a major problem. The halls were noisy and i just didn't feel safe in my room, there was no double lock other than the chain and even though I knew that you couldn't open the door from outside, it didn't "feel" secure. The housekeeping staff also had a habit of vacuuming the hallway at 7.30 am!
reviews.title: Attention to details needed to improve

reviews.text: The restaurant had just been renovated apparantly, but it really looks like it hasn't been touched since the 60's it's really old fashioned and tired looking. Breakfast was a help yourself affair - not bad and it's included in the room cost so you can't really complain. I had room service one night and the food was OK, nothing really offended me, but it really was only just passable.
reviews.title: Fine Hotel

likes.disliked: — Lack of internet access in lobby, decor a bit 80s

reviews.text: I feel like I'm being quite harsh, but there really has to be better places to stay in Budapest. It's OK really, but don't expect anything out of this world.
reviews.title: Comfortable, large rooms

likes.disliked: — Use the minibus from the airport

reviews.text: A mixed bag really. The room was big with lovely high ceiling and a nice big double bed. The room also contained a big desk and table. But the room's decor needed updating. The reception area was oddly decorated too with quite a strange mannequin in the entrance to the reception which didn't seem to fit.
reviews.title: An older hotel, but good

likes.liked: — The hotel is well located, and the rooms clean and comfortable.
likes.disliked: — Tour groups resulted in overcropwding in the restaurant.

reviews.text: This hotel is on the tour group circuit, but it is nevertheless a decent experience. The room was ample, cleaned late in the day, but well done except for the fact that drinking glasses were not replaced after use nor were they washed, and sheets were not changed for the four days we were there.
reviews.title: decent hotel with good location

reviews.text: Beds are comfortable except there is a rubberized mat under the sheets (as there was in all the Radissons we stayed in) which made the beds feel too warm after sleeping in them for a time.
reviews.title: Bad Egg

reviews.text: A large breakfast buffet was included with our room, but because of the the number of tour groups, the restaurant gets crowded quickly, especially around 8 AM. It was hard to hustle through the crowds and finding a table was sometimes a problem. Two mornings they opened an alternate room which was a big help.
reviews.title: Busy City
watch for breakfast cost
reviews.text: The selections were good to very good except for the scrambled eggs which were either underdone or overdone. Bacon, sausage, coldcuts, cheeses, smoked salmon, breads and rolls, fresh fruit, pastries, assorted cereals hot and cold, yogurt, juices, coffee and tea were constantly being refilled.

There was a funny sign that told you "eat everything, pack nothing!" The restaurant staff polices the area looking for miscreants, and if someone is caught making a sandwich for later, he is admonished by the table wardens who snatch dishes and silverware off the tables the moment your fork is off the plate.
reviews.title: High standard hotel
